fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article (One in three households losing out, 22 October, page 8) referred to figures from UK Finance as saying since the pandemic began, 4.4m payment deferrals have been granted, “including car loans and credit cards as well as mortgages”. We meant to include personal loans, not car loans, as they were not included in UK Finance figures. • A picture of a black-tailed godwit was mistakenly used to illustrate an article about a bar-tailed godwit (Clam-fuelled bird ‘as sleek as a fighter jet’ sets new non-stop flight record, 14 October, page 15). • Other recently amended articles include: ‘The militias are not allowing us back’: Sunnis languish in camps, years after recapture of Mosul The rest of the country will suffer so long as Westminster holds the purse strings England and Wales Covid lockdown for children in custody ‘cruel and inhumane’ Structural racism led to worse Covid impact on BAME groups – report US election polls tracker: who is leading in the swing states, Trump or Biden? Ontario: Doug Ford refuses to demote caucus member photographed maskless Even Victorians felt sympathy for hungry children. Why doesn’t this government?
